prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(limma)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, sep = "\t")

# Transpose the count table
count_table <- t(count_table)

# Set row names as gene names
rownames(count_table) <- count_table[, 1]
count_table <- count_table[, -1]

# Set column names as sample ids
colnames(count_table) <- annotation_data$sample_id

# Filter count table based on sample groups
group_A_genes <- count_table[, annotation_data$group == "Group A"]
group_B_genes <- count_table[, annotation_data$group == "Group B"]
group_C_genes <- count_table[, annotation_data$group == "Group C"]

# Perform statistical tests to find group specific genes
group_A_specific_genes <- rownames(count_table)[apply(group_A_genes, 1, function(x) t.test(x, group_B_genes)$p.value < 0.05)]
group_B_specific_genes <- rownames(count_table)[apply(group_B_genes, 1, function(x) t.test(x, group_A_genes)$p.value < 0.05)]
group_C_specific_genes <- rownames(count_table)[apply(group_C_genes, 1, function(x) t.test(x, group_A_genes)$p.value < 0.05)]

# Create PCA plot using group specific genes
group_specific_genes <- c(group_A_specific_genes, group_B_specific_genes, group_C_specific_genes)
pca_data <- count_table[group_specific_genes, ]
pca_result <- prcomp(t(pca_data))

# Plot PCA with color coded groups
pca_plot <- ggplot(as.data.frame(pca_result$x), aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = annotation_data$group)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  scale_color_discrete(name = "Group")
print(pca_plot)
